title: What happens when all your refuges fail?
teaser: The exhaustion of trying to find security in systems that are collapsing around you.
framework: Matthew 6:33 - Seek first the kingdom of God and his righteousness, and all these things will be added to you

panels.heading: WHEN THE SYSTEMS FAIL
panels.content:
You built your life on systems that promised stability.

The political system promised order. But now it's fracturing—coups, violence, institutional collapse. Democracy isn't holding.

The economic system promised security. But now it's failing—inflation, layoffs, stagnant wages. Your paycheck doesn't cover what it used to. The American Dream feels like a lie.

The spiritual system promised peace. But now it feels empty—commercialized, commodified, curated for clicks. You're consuming content, not encountering God.

You did everything right. You played by the rules.

And the systems are collapsing anyway.

panels.heading: THE WEIGHT OF FAILING EMPIRES
panels.content:
This is what it feels like when empires fail:

You check the news obsessively, terrified of what's next. Every headline confirms your fear: the center isn't holding.

You check your bank account constantly, calculating how long you can survive. Every bill is a reminder: you're not as secure as you thought.

You scroll through spiritual content, searching for something that sticks. Every post is polished. Every podcast is produced. But none of it reaches the ache inside you.

You're exhausted. Because you're trying to find refuge in things that can't save you.

And deep down, you know it.

panels.heading: THE COLLAPSE YOU CAN'T ESCAPE
panels.content:
The cost of trusting empires is this: **when they collapse, you collapse with them.**

Because you tied your hope to them. Your identity. Your security.

When politics fails, you panic. When the economy stumbles, you spiral. When your spiritual routine feels empty, you despair.

52% of workers feel burned out. 43% of adults are more anxious than last year. You're not just tired—you're **running on fumes**, desperately trying to hold together systems that are falling apart.

You can't fix this. You can't vote your way out. You can't earn your way to safety. You can't curate your way to peace.

The empires are failing. And you're still inside them, searching for a way out.

illustration.description: Dithered image of collapsing pillars, person buried under rubble, or crumbling infrastructure

panels.heading: THE PATTERN OF EMPIRE COLLAPSE
panels.content:
This has happened before.

2,000 years ago, Rome was the empire everyone trusted. The military superpower. The economic engine. The civilizing force.

And into that empire, a teacher stood up and said:

**"Do not store up for yourselves treasures on earth, where moths and vermin destroy, and where thieves break in and steal."**

He wasn't being poetic. He was being prophetic.

Empires fall. Markets crash. Security evaporates.

And if your hope is in them, you fall with them.

But Jesus didn't stop there. He offered an alternative:

**"Seek first the kingdom of God."**

Not the empire. The kingdom.

Because empires collapse. But the kingdom endures.

panels.heading: THE INVITATION TO LET GO
panels.content:
What if the collapse isn't the end?

What if it's the invitation?

The invitation to stop clinging to empires that can't save you.
The invitation to stop building on sand.
The invitation to stop searching for refuge in systems that are already failing.

You can't fix the political system. You can't stabilize the economy. You can't force spiritual depth from consumer content.

But you can let go.

You can stop trying to hold up what's already falling.

And you can seek something that won't collapse.

The kingdom of God. Not later. Not somewhere else.

Here. Now. In the midst of the rubble.

panels.heading: THE INVITATION
panels.content:
God,

Everything I trusted is failing.

The political system. The economy. The spiritual routines. All of it is crumbling.

I'm exhausted from trying to hold it together. From searching for refuge in things that can't save me.

You said not to store up treasures on earth. Because they fail.

Teach me to let go. Teach me to seek Your kingdom instead.

Even when the empires collapse. Especially then.

Amen.
